decks.notes: The deck focuses on using Doomsday to assemble a winning combo quickly. Cards like Vexing Bauble and Street Wraith help filter the deck for key pieces. Thassa's Oracle is used as the win condition, while Personal Tutor and Brainstorm help set up the Doomsday pile efficiently. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo. Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual provide additional mana acceleration to cast Doomsday early. Overall, the deck aims to set up and execute the Doomsday combo as quickly and efficiently as possible to win the game.

The deck is focused on playing aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and True-Name Nemesis while using disruptive spells like Force of Will, Daze, and Stifle to control the game. It also includes card draw and manipulation spells such as Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain to help dig for key cards. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides additional card advantage and Brazen Borrower offers tempo plays. Murktide Regent acts as a big threat that can close out games quickly. The deck aims to pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Cloudpost and Glimmerpost lands, as well as cards like Crop Rotation and The One Ring. Once enough mana is generated, the deck aims to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog and Emrakul to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive tools like Karn, the Great Creator and Disruptor Flute to control the game and give the player an advantage. Overall, the goal is to assemble a powerful board state and quickly finish off the opponent with massive threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing creature disruption and removal spells to control the board while putting pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures. By using Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and cards like Swords to Plowshares for removal, the deck aims to disrupt and slow down the opponent's game plan. The creatures in the deck have abilities that can further disrupt the opponent, such as Containment Priest shutting down graveyard strategies and Skyclave Apparition removing problematic permanents. Overall, the deck aims to control the battlefield and overwhelm the opponent with its efficient creatures and disruption spells.

This deck focuses on filling your graveyard with powerful creatures, then bringing them back to the battlefield quickly and efficiently. By using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, you can cheat expensive creatures into play for a low cost. You also have disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect your combo pieces and disrupt your opponent's game plan. The deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with powerful creatures early in the game, while also having control elements to help protect your strategy.

This deck focuses on combining powerful artifacts like Coveted Jewel and The One Ring with cards that can manipulate them and generate mana quickly, such as Grim Monolith and Mox Opal. It aims to quickly assemble a board state that allows for explosive plays, including casting Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or using Show and Tell to cheat out game-winning cards. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of powerful artifacts and disruptive spells, while utilizing the synergies between the different pieces to create a strong combo strategy.

The key strategy of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan using a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, alongside counterspells such as Force of Will and Force of Negation. Additionally, the deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Sheoldred's Edict, while drawing cards and filtering through the library with Brainstorm and Ponder. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Brazen Borrower, Murktide Regent, and Baleful Strix to pressure the opponent and close out the game.

The deck focuses on using a combination of reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring powerful creatures like Worldgorger Dragon and Griselbrand onto the battlefield quickly. It also includes disruption spells like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's game plan while setting up the combo. The deck aims to win by cheating out high-impact threats early in the game and overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures. It also includes some versatile creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Archon of Cruelty to provide additional utility and value.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifact cards to quickly generate mana and control the board, while also benefiting from synergies with cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Saga. By combining aggro tactics with artifact manipulation, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with versatile threats and disruption, making it difficult for them to formulate a cohesive defense. The inclusion of counterspells like Force of Will and Metallic Rebuke further enhances the deck's ability to disrupt opponents' strategies, ultimately paving the way for swift victories through aggressive artifact-based plays.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill the opponent's library. The deck includes cards like Goblin Engineer and Goblin Welder to tutor and recur key pieces, while also utilizing disruptive cards like Red Elemental Blast and Pyroblast to protect the combo. Agatha's Soul Cauldron and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide additional ways to manipulate the opponent's library. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Ensnaring Bridge while setting up the combo for a win condition.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Blood Moon and Chalice of the Void while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Fury. It aims to lock down the game early with cards like Trinisphere and then finish off the opponent with powerful dragon creatures like Broadside Bombardiers and Sundering Eruption. The deck also has some removal in the form of Unlicensed Hearse and versatile spells like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. Overall, the deck aims to establish early dominance and close out the game quickly.
